Name: Pattern Recognition - IND
Text: First, I need to understand the normative process. The strict rules require a specific sequence of activities. The sequence is: Application Received Credit Check Risk Assessment Loan Decision Inform Applicant [If Approved: Finalize Documentation] Close Case. Also, there are ordering rules: Credit Check before Risk Assessment, Risk Assessment before Loan Decision, Inform Applicant after Loan Decision. If approved, finalize before closing; if rejected, dont finalize before closing. Also, no skipping or reversing steps, and no finalizing after rejection.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now, looking at the event logs. Lets go through each case one by one. Case 1: Timestamps are all in order. The sequence is followed: Application Received, then Credit Check, Risk Assessment, Loan Decision (Approved), Inform Applicant, Finalize Documentation, Close Case. All steps are in order. Since its approved, finalize before closing. So this case is compliant with all norms. No violations.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - NE
Text: Case 2: Application Received at 2024-01-11 08:00. Then Risk Assessment at 08:20, but no Credit Check yet. Thats a violation because Credit Check must come before Risk Assessment. So this case has a violation here.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - NE
Text: Case 3: Application Received at 2024-01-12. Then Credit Check at 14th, which is 24 hours later. The desiderata says Credit Check should be within 24 hours. So this is a desideratum violation. Then Risk Assessment at 14th, which is okay. Loan Decision at 14th, which is 2 days later. The desideratum says inform should be within 48 hours. Here, Inform is at 16th, which is 2 days later. So thats another desideratum violation. Also, Finalize Documentation at 17th, which is allowed because its after the loan decision. But the desiderata says to do a follow-up call before closing. Case 3 has no follow-up call, which is not a strict rule but a desideratum. So this case has two desideratum violations.
